name: Aharoni-Zerbib Hypergraph Generalization
description: Generalize Tuza from triangles (3-edges) to r-uniform hypergraphs. Conjecture: τ(H) ≤ ⌈(r+1)/2⌉ν(H) for r-uniform hypergraphs.

conjecture.statement: For r-uniform hypergraph H: τ(H) ≤ ⌈(r+1)/2⌉ · ν(H)

connection_to_ryser.statement: Ryser's Conjecture: τ(H) ≤ (r-1)ν(H) for r-partite r-uniform hypergraphs
connection_to_ryser.note: Aharoni-Zerbib is intermediate between Tuza and Ryser

literature.title: Tuza's conjecture for hypergraphs
key_results: Proves fractional version for all r

connection_to_our_lemmas.key_insight: Triangle = 3-edge, so our machinery is the r=3 special case

attack_strategy.approach: Prove r=4 case using generalized versions of our lemmas
scaffold_with: Our proven r=3 lemmas as template

why_tractable: Our 30 lemmas are the r=3 case. Generalizing to r=4 is natural next step. Less competition than main Tuza.
